article.headline: UMKC 80, Central Arkansas 68
article.story: Kansas City, MO. (AP) -- Quinton Day scored 19 of his 25 points in the second half, leading Missouri-Kansas City to an 80-68 victory over Central Arkansas on Saturday night. Day had 14 points in the last 14 minutes for the Kangaroos (4-8), who ended a five-game skid and broke a three-game winning streak by the Bears (4-6). Brent Stephens added 16 points, Dee Ayuba had 13 and Blake Crawford finished with 10 for Missouri-Kansas City. Marcus Pillow hit a 3-pointer with 1:22 left, getting Central Arkansas within 70-66, but the Kangaroos went 8-for-9 from the line in the final minute to seal their win. Nate Bowie led the Bears, who committed 20 turnovers against the Kangaroos' zone defense, with 14 points. Durrell Nevels added 12 points, and Pillow and Fernando Johnson finished with 11 points each.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
